posts.title: -       Foreign manufacturers face fees, inspections under the strict certification regime Dorji ...
posts.description: -       Foreign manufacturers face fees, inspections under the strict certification regime Dorji Choden Starting next year, only products certified by the Bhutan Standards Bureau (BSB) will be permitted for import into Bhutan. This rule is based on the Bhutan Standards Act 2010, which gives BSB the authority to stop the import of products that do not meet national standards unless the product is made to even higher standards. https://kuenselonline.com/.../only-bsb-certified-products... #BSB #Bhutan
posts.content: -       Foreign manufacturers face fees, inspections under the strict certification regime Dorji Choden Starting next year, only products certified by the Bhutan Standards Bureau (BSB) will be permitted for import into Bhutan. This rule is based on the Bhutan Standards Act 2010, which gives BSB the authority to stop the import of products that do not meet national standards unless the product is made to even higher standards. https://kuenselonline.com/.../only-bsb-certified-products... #BSB #Bhutan

posts.title: Editorial:       Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our country
posts.description: . Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evilsâ€”including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https://kuenselonline.com/news/a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan
posts.content: Editorial:       Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our country. Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evilsâ€”including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https://kuenselonline.com/news/a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 p...
posts.description: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that â€œa resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.â€ He emphasized the mediaâ€™s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth
posts.content: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that â€œa resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.â€ He emphasized the mediaâ€™s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth

posts.title: Breaking: AFC Challenge League Group Stage to be held in Bhutan as Paro FC advances The Asian Foo...
posts.description: Breaking: AFC Challenge League Group Stage to be held in Bhutan as Paro FC advances The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has confirmed that Bhutan will host the group stage of the AFC Challenge League in Thimphu, following Paro FCâ€™s emphatic victory over Abu Muslim in the preliminary round. The win propels Paro FC into history once again, as the club becomes the first Bhutanese team to host an AFC League fixture in the capital for the second time. The official fixture draw is scheduled for August 28, 2025, when Paro FC will learn their next opponent. Match dates and kick-off times will be announced after the draw.
posts.content: Breaking: AFC Challenge League Group Stage to be held in Bhutan as Paro FC advances The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has confirmed that Bhutan will host the group stage of the AFC Challenge League in Thimphu, following Paro FCâ€™s emphatic victory over Abu Muslim in the preliminary round. The win propels Paro FC into history once again, as the club becomes the first Bhutanese team to host an AFC League fixture in the capital for the second time. The official fixture draw is scheduled for August 28, 2025, when Paro FC will learn their next opponent. Match dates and kick-off times will be announced after the draw.

posts.title: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airline...
posts.description: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airlines have been instructed to discontinue the subsidised airfare scheme for tourists, following a directive issued by the Department of Tourism (DoT) in August. The order, according to Drukair CEO Tandi Wangchuk, came from the Ministry of Finance. He said that the DoT is working to reimburse airlines for tickets already sold under the scheme. https://kuenselonline.com/.../government-discontinues... #DoT #Tourism #TCB #Bhutan
posts.content: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airlines have been instructed to discontinue the subsidised airfare scheme for tourists, following a directive issued by the Department of Tourism (DoT) in August. The order, according to Drukair CEO Tandi Wangchuk, came from the Ministry of Finance. He said that the DoT is working to reimburse airlines for tickets already sold under the scheme. https://kuenselonline.com/.../government-discontinues... #DoT #Tourism #TCB #Bhutan

posts.title: â€˜               â€™ Our vision is to make Paro FC synonymous with excellence in Bhutanese football
posts.description: . We aspire to be a club that consistently represents Bhutan at the AFC level and competes against some of the best teams in Asia. Beyond football results, we want to create a professionally managed, financially sustainable club with modern infrastructure and strong governance. A key part of this vision is to establish a high-standard academy that nurtures local players into future national stars. At the same time, we aim to build a passionate and loyal fan base, making Paro FC a benchmark for professional football in Bhutan. https://kuenselonline.com/.../our-vision-is-to-show... #sports #ParoFC #football #Bhutan
posts.content: â€˜               â€™ Our vision is to make Paro FC synonymous with excellence in Bhutanese football. We aspire to be a club that consistently represents Bhutan at the AFC level and competes against some of the best teams in Asia. Beyond football results, we want to create a professionally managed, financially sustainable club with modern infrastructure and strong governance. A key part of this vision is to establish a high-standard academy that nurtures local players into future national stars. In line with ğ’ğğœğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ ğŸ“.ğŸ‘.ğŸ.ğŸ’ of the ğğ‚ğ’ğ‘ ğŸğŸğŸğŸ‘, the Commission decided to set the passing cut-off mark of the ğğ«ğğ¥ğ¢ğ¦ğ¢ğ§ğšğ«ğ² ğ„ğ±ğšğ¦ğ¢ğ§ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ (ğğ„) at ğŸ±ğŸ±. Those who scored 55 and above in PE will be eligible to sit for the main Examination. A total of 1726 graduates who have scored above the cut-off mark in PE, and 698 graduates who were waived from the requirement to appear PE will sit for the Main Examination (ME) scheduled to be held on 9, 10, and 11th, October 2025. In line with section 5.8.2 of BCSR 2023, candidates will be allowed to appeal for a recount. Candidates are required to submit the application form requesting the recounting of the PE score within 5 working days from August 21   27, 2025, and submit it to the Exam Office behind Drukair Office, Chubachu, Thimphu, or email it to bcse@rcsc.gov.bt Download Appeal recounting form : click here https:  shorturl.at BrHgZ ğƒğğ‚ğ”ğŒğ„ğğ“ ğ•ğ„ğ‘ğˆğ…ğˆğ‚ğ€ğ“ğˆğğ ğ…ğğ‘ ğğ‚ğ’ğ„ - ğŸğŸğŸğŸ“ The next step for the BCSE 2025 is  document verification . The verification of documents will be held as follows: Date : August 25 - September 3, 2025 Venue : Hotel Dorji Element (Opposite to Tarayana Centre, Lower Chubachu) Schedule: Day-wise schedule as per the categories click here https:  shorturl.at QJcU0 to check the schedule Documents required : Click here https:  shorturl.at xIkUn All Graduates, including graduates with PGDNL aspiring to join the civil service, are required to report in person for document verification to sign the letter of undertaking on the academic score of the Bachelor's Degree during the time of verification. Graduates are requested to follow the schedule as far as possible. Click here for the result: https:  bcse.rcsc.gov.bt Login

posts.title: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 p...
posts.description: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that  a resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.  He emphasized the media s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth
posts.content: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that  a resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.  He emphasized the media s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth

Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evils including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https:  kuenselonline.com news a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan

While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https:  kuenselonline.com news a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Servic...
posts.description: Update of His Majesty s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation

The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation
